WANT TO BE AN NVIDIAN? Here’s how to get started doing your life’s work. 1: SEARCH & APPLY Explore all the roles Find the ones that match your skills and interests. Get noticed Make sure that your resume aligns with the position you’re interested in and apply directly through our website or by using your LinkedIn profile. It’s OK to apply for the top five roles that best match your background. Hear back We’ll let you know when we’ve received your info and if there’s a match.
2: LET’S MEET Connect You’ll meet with the hiring manager, team members, and employees from other groups—by phone, video or in person. Depending on the role, you may have several interviews.

If your skills and background match a different role, or if a new opportunity opens up during this process, you may be invited to interview for that position as well. Prepare One-on-one, small group, or panel interviews usually lasts 30-60 minutes each. Prospects for technical roles may be asked to complete a coding exercise, which is usually done via Hackerrank, on a whiteboard or laptop that we provide. Tap your recruiter Get fast help with any suggestions or questions. And a tip: NVIDIANs tend toward business casual but wear what’s comfortable for you. 3: JOIN THE TEAM Wait for our decision We’ll get back to you in a few short weeks with next steps.
Review your offer If it’s a green light, you’ll receive your offer from the recruiter. If you accept, sign and send back we’ll start your new hire onboarding.

You’re an NVIDIAN! Sit back and stay tuned for an email with details about your upcoming orientation. FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS Where do I learn more about NVIDIA? You can learn more about us on our website, follow our news updates, or visit our blog. When will I hear if I’ve been selected to interview? Ideally, candidates who are selected to move forward will hear from our recruiting team within a couple of weeks of their application.
What’s the process for a referral candidate? Reach out to an NVIDIA Employee that you know and ask them to refer you through the internal job board.

Then, watch for an email from NVIDIA-HR inviting you to complete your application. If there’s a match we’ll contact you. Is there a limit to the number of roles I can apply to? While there’s no official limit, we recommend that you limit your applications to the top 3 to 5 roles that best match your interests and experience. This will give you the best chance to be considered for roles that are relevant for you. I need an accommodation for my interview.
Who do I contact? For assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, contact NVIDIA HR at 408-486-1405 or provide your contact information prior to your interview and we will contact you.

If I’m contacted to interview with multiple teams, will this impact my chance of getting hired? You’re welcome to explore multiple opportunities, but in the event that you are interviewing with multiple teams, feedback may be shared across teams. This is another reason that we recommend focusing on the roles you’re best qualified for. How long does the overall interview process take? Most candidates will have a decision within a matter of weeks from their first interview, but the process duration depends on a number of factors. We recommend being open and honest with the recruiting team about any timing concerns or deadlines so we can try to expedite if needed.
How is the interview process structured? For full-time roles, you’ll typically be asked to participate in phone interviews, followed by virtual or in-person interviews.

Some teams may have a slightly different process to better suit their requirements. Interns will typically complete phone interviews only. Where can I read NVIDIAs Applicant Privacy Policy? Read our Applicant Privacy Policy here. READY TO JOIN US? GET STARTED HERE NVIDIA is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to fostering a diverse environment.

NVIDIA is committed to offering reasonable accommodations, upon request, to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact Human Resources at 408-486-1405 or provide your contact information and we will contact you.
